item.title: 千年一遇暴雨的真正含义
item.description:
飓风 "海伦 "是上个月袭击北卡罗来纳州的两场千年一遇的风暴之一，这突出表明有必要更清楚地了解极端洪水的风险。【原文：

Hurricane Helene was one of two 1,000-year storms to hit North Carolina last month, underscoring the need for more clearly understanding the risks of extreme deluges.

】

item.title: 阿什维尔的脏水警告老化的美国基础设施面临气候风险
item.description:
飓风海伦（Helene）和米尔顿（Milton）等狂风暴雨以及酷热和干旱有可能使全国的水处理厂不堪重负。【原文：

Fierce storms like Hurricanes Helene and Milton, as well as extreme heat and drought, threaten to overwhelm the nation’s water treatment plants.

】

item.title: 即使获得救助，Northvolt 仍面临重大障碍
item.description: 在获得 3 亿美元的救助后，Northvolt AB 似乎躲过了一场对其生存的重大威胁。然而，这家负债累累的电池制造商的长期前景依然充满变数。【原文：With a $300 million bailout in its sights, Northvolt AB appears to have dodged a major threat to its existence. Yet longer term prospects for the debt-laden battery maker remain fraught.】

item.title: 维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）称未来五年内 "融合将成为现实
item.description:
这位亿万富翁投资人认为，这项技术是为人工智能推动的数据中心繁荣脱碳的一种方式。【原文：

The billionaire investor sees the technology as a way to decarbonize the AI-fueled data center boom.

】

item.title: 暴雨淹没家园和农作物，法国继续保持警惕
item.description: 法国仍然对西南部的暴雨和洪水保持警惕，而北部则因强降水而略有缓和，强降水使生活陷入停顿，农作物的收割和播种也受到干扰。【原文：France remains on alert for heavy rain and flooding in the southwest while the north gets a slight reprieve from the intense precipitation that has thrown life out of gear and disrupted crop harvesting and planting.】

item.title: 美国投资 20 亿美元用于电网项目以抵御风暴
item.description: 拜登政府将提供近 20 亿美元资金，帮助美国电网抵御极端天气，并扩大输电项目。【原文：The Biden administration is awarding nearly $2 billion in funding to help steel the US power grid against extreme weather and to expand transmission projects.】

item.title: 莫迪家乡的印度城市考虑发行 2 亿美元绿色债券
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的家乡古吉拉特邦（Gujarat）的一个城市正在酝酿发行首只绿色市政债券，销售所得将用于资助一系列旨在减少碳排放的项目。【原文：An Indian city in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s home state of Gujarat is mulling its first green muni bond, with proceeds from the sale to be used for funding a range of projects aimed at reducing carbon emissions.】

item.title: 印度研究削减关税以促进绿色氢能发展
item.description: 印度正在考虑削减生产绿色氢气所需机械的进口关税，因为该国正努力成为这种清洁燃料的主要中心。【原文：India is considering cuts to tariffs on imports of machinery needed to manufacture green hydrogen, as the nation pushes to become a major hub for the cleaner fuel.】

item.title: 欧盟的 "绿色转变 "受到威胁，消费者受到切实打击
item.description: 欧盟在五年前推出了 "绿色协议"，目标是使其成为欧盟增长的基石，并为世界制定议程。现在，分歧已经取代了大张旗鼓的宣传，清洁工业时代的领导权有可能拱手让给美国和中国。【原文：The European Union unveiled its Green Deal five years ago with the goal of making it the cornerstone of the bloc’s growth and setting the agenda for the world. Fault lines have now replaced fanfare, and risk handing leadership of the clean industrial era to the US and China.】

item.title: 英伟达支持的公司在日本核电站附近建立数据中心
item.description: 一家由 Nvidia 公司支持的云服务公司希望在日本建立一个新的数据中心，但有一个前提条件：附近必须有核电。【原文：An Nvidia Corp.-backed cloud services firm wants to build a new data center in Japan, with one prerequisite: there should be nuclear power available nearby.】

item.title: 加州因火灾威胁开始对 5,400 名用户停电
item.description: 加利福尼亚公用事业巨头 PG&E 公司开始切断电力供应，以减少公司设备在狂风和干燥条件下引发野火的几率。【原文：California utility giant PG&E Corp. started cutting power supplies to reduce the chances of the company’s equipment igniting wildfires amid gusty winds and dry conditions.】

item.title: 美国授予 Centrus 和 Orano 铀浓缩合同
item.description: 拜登政府已授予 Centrus Energy Corp. 和 Orano SA 等公司开发新型先进核反应堆所需的高浓缩铀的合同。【原文：The Biden administration has awarded Centrus Energy Corp. and Orano SA, among others, with contracts to develop highly enriched uranium that will be needed for a new breed of advanced nuclear reactors.】

item.title: 全球森林火灾碳排放量在 20 年内猛增 60
item.description:
一项新的研究发现，高纬度地区林地燃烧产生的废气排放量增长最快。【原文：

A new study finds that emissions from burning woodlands in higher latitudes are growing at the fastest rate. 

】

item.title: 大雪侵袭水牛城，纽约市今冬将泡汤
item.description: 随着加利福尼亚州到佛罗里达州的天气转暖，西北太平洋地区和大平原北部将笼罩在浓浓的寒意中，纽约市和东海岸将可能度过一个潮湿的冬天。【原文：New York City and the East Coast will likely have a soggy winter as warmer weather takes hold from California to Florida, and a deep chill settles across the Pacific Northwest and northern Great Plains.】

item.title: Northvolt 接近 3 亿美元一揽子救援计划以维持生存
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，Northvolt AB 公司即将获得 3 亿美元的一揽子救援计划，为这家资金短缺的瑞典电池制造商稳定生产和获得长期融资赢得了时间。【原文：Northvolt AB is closing in on a $300 million rescue package, according to a person familiar with the matter, buying time for the cash-strapped Swedish battery maker to stabilize production and line up longer-term financing.】

item.title: 贝莱德被激进分子盯上，要求法国 AMF 进行 ESG 调查
item.description: 非营利组织 ClientEarth 已向法国市场监管机构举报贝莱德公司，称该资产管理公司对其部分基金的可持续发展宣称具有误导性。【原文：BlackRock Inc. has been reported to France’s markets regulator by nonprofit ClientEarth, which alleges the asset manager is making misleading sustainability claims about some of its funds.】

item.title: 随着风力增大，加州在整个周末都将面临危险的火灾风险
item.description:
已发出红色火灾警告，电力公司表示可能需要切断电力供应。【原文：

Red flag fire warnings have been raised and utilities have said they could need to cut power supplies. 

】

item.title: 在绿色和平组织的故乡，不列颠哥伦比亚省的气候目标面临选举逆流
item.description: 这位加拿大第三大省的政治新贵因对气候科学持怀疑态度而被原党派开除，但他承诺放弃环保目标，放开自然资源开发，赢得政权指日可待。【原文：An unlikely political upstart in Canada’s third-largest province, expelled from his previous party for climate science skepticism, is within striking distance of winning power with promises to ditch environmental targets and unleash natural-resources development.】

item.title: 大自然的金融创新带来希望，也引发了对 "洗绿 "的担忧
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将介绍查尔斯国王和其他英国土地所有者如何进入一个新市场来拯救自然。应对生物多样性危机以及金融可以发挥的作用将是下周 COP16 峰会的焦点。阅读本篇报道的完整版本，请访问 Bloomberg.com。有关气候变化和环境的更多报道，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at how King Charles and other British landowners are jumping into a new market to save nature. Tackling the biodiversity crisis, and the role finance can play, will be the focus of next week’s COP16 summit. Read the full version of this story at Bloomberg.com. For more coverage of climate change and the environment, please subscribe.】

item.title: 美国大选让气候科技投资者进入观望模式
item.description:
由于融资方和创始人都在面对特朗普第二次当选总统的前景及其对减碳技术的影响，因此资本市场停滞不前。【原文：

Capital has stalled as financers and founders confront the prospect of a second Trump presidency and its impact on carbon-cutting technologies.

】

item.title: 拉尼娜现象可能引发极地涡旋事件，欧洲为寒流做好准备
item.description: 随着弱拉尼娜天气模式的最终到来，欧洲预计将迎来一个凉爽无风的 11 月，这将为今年冬天带来更高的极地涡旋事件风险。【原文：Europe is forecast to have a cool and windless November as a weak La Niña weather pattern finally arrives, bringing a higher risk of polar vortex events this winter.】

item.title: Uber 首席执行官谈电动汽车、Robotaxis 和气候目标
item.description:
"我们认为 Uber 的未来是电动的、共享的、自主的，最终也是多式联运的，"Uber 首席执行官达拉-科斯罗萨西（Dara Khosrowshahi）在本周的Zero节目中说道。【原文：

“We think that the future for Uber is electric, shared, autonomous and ultimately multimodal as well,” Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi says on this week’s episode of Zero.

】

item.title: 查尔斯国王和大银行投身拯救自然的新市场
item.description:
在金融家和外交官齐聚联合国生物多样性峰会之际，英国土地所有者正在探索新兴保护市场的前景和风险。【原文：

As financiers and diplomats gather for the UN’s biodiversity summit, British landowners are exploring the promise — and risk — of nascent markets for conservation.

】

item.title: 悉尼著名的邦迪海滩因有毒沥青球冲上岸而关闭
item.description: 最近几天，数以千计的有毒焦油球被冲上海岸，悉尼著名的邦迪海滩（Bondi Beach）已经关闭，该市风景如画的东海岸其他几个热门游泳地点也已关闭。【原文：Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach has been closed, joining several other popular swimming spots along the city’s picturesque east coast, after thousands of toxic tar balls washed ashore in recent days.】

item.title: 英国努力消除银行家在过渡融资问题上的 "瘫痪状态
item.description: 如果银行和投资者要为高碳企业转型为未来的绿色企业提供资金，那么决策者和公众就需要更大程度地接受这一点，即这将使金融家的投资组合看起来更脏。【原文：If banks and investors are going to finance the transformation of high-carbon companies into the green corporations of tomorrow, there needs to be a greater acceptance by policymakers and the public that this will make financiers’ portfolios look dirtier.】

item.title: 摩根大通为萨尔瓦多完成 10 亿美元债务转换交易
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has structured a $1 billion deal for El Salvador, equivalent to roughly 14% of its debt, in an arrangement that allows the country to refinance a portion of its debt and help fund the conservation of its wetlands.】

item.title: 夏威夷公用事业公司因野火威胁切断毛伊岛电力
item.description: 夏威夷电力公司（Hawaiian Electric）表示，由于大风和干燥的环境为野火风险创造了成熟的条件，该公司将切断茂宜岛西侧社区的电力供应。【原文：Hawaiian Electric said it will cut power to communities on the western side of Maui as high winds and dry conditions create conditions ripe for the risk of wildfires.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 在商业机密案中被要求支付 6.049 亿美元
item.description: 陪审团表示，菲利普斯 66 公司在准备进军加州可再生能源市场时，曾考虑收购一家低碳燃料供应商，但该公司窃取了该供应商的商业机密，菲利普斯 66 公司应为此支付 6.049 亿美元。【原文：Phillips 66 should pay $604.9 million for stealing trade secrets from a low-carbon fuel provider that it considered acquiring while preparing to enter the California renewables market, a jury said.】

item.title: 报告警告：水危机危及高收入国家 8%的 GDP
item.description:
水资源匮乏、降雨模式变化和地下水过度使用都对世界经济构成日益严峻的威胁。【原文：

Scarcity, changing rainfall patterns and groundwater overuse all pose an increasingly dire threat to the world economy.

】

item.title: 美国为吉沃清洁燃料项目提供 14.6 亿美元融资
item.description: 拜登政府正在向生物燃料公司 Gevo Inc. 提供 14.6 亿美元的融资，用于在南达科他州普雷斯顿湖建立将玉米淀粉转化为喷气燃料的大型设施。【原文：The Biden administration is offering biofuel company Gevo Inc. $1.46 billion in financing for a large-scale facility that turns corn starch into jet fuel in Lake Preston, South Dakota.】
